title: Simple and Effective Ways to Stay Hydrated Overnight

steps.title: While a little obvious, this can help you stay hydrated overnight.
steps.content: While a little obvious, this can help you stay hydrated overnight. Many people avoid drinking water before bed because they don’t want to constantly pee throughout the night. However, a small glass of water is unlikely to get you up in the middle of the night. 1 cup (0.2 liters) of water before bedtime can keep you from waking up due to thirst. [1] X Trustworthy Source Cleveland Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source A glass of water before bed can also prevent leg cramps during the night and a headache in the morning, which are often caused by dehydration.

steps.title: A hot bedroom can make you sweat and lose water during the night.
steps.content: A hot bedroom can make you sweat and lose water during the night. It’s well known that a cool bedroom helps you sleep better , but it also keeps you better hydrated. Turn your thermostat down to around 60-67° F (16-19° C) for a hydrating, cozy, and restful sleep. [2] X Research source Turn on a standing fan or open your window to cool your room quickly . Sleep in breathable, cotton pajamas and use lightweight sheets and blankets to stay comfortable on a hot night .

steps.title: Have water at the ready if you wake up in the night dehydrated.
steps.content: Have water at the ready if you wake up in the night dehydrated. Getting up for a glass of water in the middle of the night can make it difficult for you to fall back asleep. Prepare ahead of time with a glass of water on your nightstand to help ensure that you get good quality sleep if you wake up. [3] X Trustworthy Source Cleveland Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source Keeping a glass of water by your bed can also be a way to remind yourself to drink before bed.

steps.title: Overnight dehydration is often caused by general dehydration.
steps.content: Overnight dehydration is often caused by general dehydration. On average, men need about 15.5 cups (3.7 liters) of fluids a day to stay hydrated while women need about 11.5 cups (2.7 liters). Drink enough water by having a glass before and during every meal, after you exercise, and of course, when you feel thirsty. [4] X Trustworthy Source National Health Service (UK) Public healthcare system of the UK Go to source If you have trouble drinking enough water , track your progress with an app or carry a water bottle with you for easy access. Milk, tea, and juice are all high in water content if you have trouble drinking plain water.

steps.title: Sodium, one of the main electrolytes, helps you retain water.
steps.content: Sodium, one of the main electrolytes, helps you retain water. As you sweat and breathe throughout the day, you lose sodium, which you can’t gain back through just water. If you’re sweating a lot due to exercise, or just want a hydration boost, pick up an electrolyte-enhanced drink or make your own . [5] X Trustworthy Source Cleveland Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source

steps.title: The foods you eat can help you stay hydrated overnight.
steps.content: The foods you eat can help you stay hydrated overnight. Fruits and vegetables like apples, strawberries, cucumbers, broccoli, and spinach are nearly 100% water. Incorporate them into your diet, along with drinking water, to keep your hydration levels up. [6] X Research source

steps.title: It’s important to replenish the fluids you lose overnight.
steps.content: It’s important to replenish the fluids you lose overnight. You naturally lose water by just moving and breathing, so not drinking water for 8 hours as you sleep leads to a lot of water loss! [7] X Research source Start your day off strong with a glass of water to get you ready and active for the day. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Coffee is a mild diuretic that might dehydrate you.
steps.content: Coffee is a mild diuretic that might dehydrate you. While coffee is full of water, it won’t hydrate you as well. It’s a good idea to wait 1 to 2 hours before drinking your coffee to give yourself time to replenish yourself with water. [9] X Trustworthy Source National Health Service (UK) Public healthcare system of the UK Go to source A diuretic is any substance that increases your need to pee, which also increases your fluid loss. However, aim to drink your coffee at least 6 hours before you go to sleep. Consuming caffeine 6 hours or less before your bedtime can cause shorter and poorer quality sleep. [10] X Research source

steps.title: Stop drinking alcohol several hours before bed to stay hydrated overnight.
steps.content: Stop drinking alcohol several hours before bed to stay hydrated overnight. You’ve probably experienced a pounding headache after a fun night out – this is because alcohol is a diuretic like coffee. If you know you’ll be drinking, make sure to drink a glass of water for every drink to keep yourself hydrated by the time you go to bed. [11] X Research source

steps.title: Snoring and sleep apnea can dehydrate you overnight.
steps.content: Snoring and sleep apnea can dehydrate you overnight. If you snore, you probably sleep with your mouth open, which can dry out your throat and mouth. If you know that you snore and continue to wake up dehydrated, consult your normal doctor or a sleep physician. [12] X Research source Some experts believe that dehydration leads to snoring. Regardless, make sure you are staying hydrated. [13] X Research source

steps.title: Sleeping for longer can help you stay and wake up hydrated.
steps.content: Sleeping for longer can help you stay and wake up hydrated. Research on sleep and hydration shows that people who sleep for a shorter amount of time are more likely to wake up dehydrated. Make sure to get a good night’s sleep to stay hydrated overnight. [14] X Trustworthy Source Harvard Medical School Harvard Medical School's Educational Site for the Public Go to source Experts believe that the hormone vasopressin signals our kidneys to retain water overnight. If you sleep less than 8 hours, less of that hormone can reach your kidneys, so you retain less water and become dehydrated.
